title: A1706 No image, No video
message:
A1706 came in for flexgate issue.. I replaced the screen and forgot to disconnect the battery.. smh.. Now new screen shows no back light, no video also no external video with HDMI... I am getting the required 20v with tester but it wont chime or turn on.. Fans spin and track pad works.. I took board out but I can't find any signs of a blown anything.. Where should I start to get to the problem of this? Thank you so much.
i also dont have access to shemactics so if you can screen shot me somthing that would be much apprecaited.

title: A1706 No image, No video
message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Test external video disconnecting internal LCD.
Also check CPU core voltage after 10-15 seconds.

For schematics, tell us the exact 820-xxxxx code of your MLB; 00239, or 00923.
Write MLB code on the title of the future threads.

title: A1706 No image, No video
message:
"check CPU core voltage after 10-15 seconds"
L7210/20...

1.9v on vcore

title: A1706 No image, No video
message:
That is really high value for CPU core; check it on the output pin of the coils, where the filter caps are placed.
Test the board alone on the desk; nothing connected, apart of charger.

title: A1706 No image, No video
message: I recommend you to check for knocked off components, or broken traces.
